name: Computing Data Protection
description: Sector template for data protection patents including encryption at rest, data loss prevention (DLP), secure storage, key management, and data confidentiality mechanisms.
contextDescription: Computing data protection patents secure data at rest and prevent unauthorized data access or exfiltration. Technologies include full disk encryption, file-level encryption, DLP, secure key storage, tokenization, and data masking.
scoringGuidance: Patents with transparent encryption (user unaware) score higher on usability but must maintain security.
Key management that supports regulatory compliance (GDPR, HIPAA key deletion) is high value.
DLP patents with content-aware policies and ML-based classification score higher.
Hardware-accelerated encryption (AES-NI, storage controller encryption) improves performance scoring.

questions.question: At what granularity is data encrypted? Score 1-3 for full-disk only, 4-6 for file/folder level, 7-10 for field-level or attribute-based encryption.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe encryption granularity: disk, volume, file, field, or attribute level.

questions.question: How comprehensive is key lifecycle management? Score 1-3 for basic key storage, 4-6 for rotation and revocation, 7-10 for full lifecycle (generation, distribution, rotation, archival, destruction).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess key lifecycle: generation, storage, rotation, revocation, destruction.

questions.question: Does this patent include DLP capabilities? Score 1-3 if none, 4-6 for basic content filtering, 7-10 for advanced DLP (ML classification, contextual policies, multi-channel).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe DLP features: content inspection, policy enforcement, channel coverage.

questions.question: How well does this patent support regulatory compliance? Score 1-3 if not addressed, 4-6 for basic audit logging, 7-10 for comprehensive compliance (GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, crypto agility).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify compliance frameworks and audit capabilities supported.

questions.question: How well does encryption integrate with access control? Score 1-3 for password-based only, 4-6 for user/group policies, 7-10 for attribute-based or policy-driven access with encryption.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe how encryption keys are bound to access control policies.
